citeinfo.title: PORTS_NTAD_IN: Ports in Indiana derived from the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (Bureau of Transportation Statistics, 1:100,000, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit:
Data is available from the Bureau of Transportation Statistics, at the following URL:
http://www.bts.gov/publications/north_american_transportation_atlas_data/

descript.abstract: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) Ports database is an extract from the National Waterway Network database consisting of 224 points coded as U.S. Army Corps of Engineers ports. This dataset is an extraction for Indiana from the national database and contains 6 points representing USACE ports.
descript.purpose:
This dataset was compiled to provide locations and attributes for ports in Indiana. This dataset is available for viewing and for free downloading on the Indiana Geological Survey statewide GIS Web site titled "A GIS Atlas of Indiana." It is intended for a variety of uses by the public recognizing that the horizontal accuracy does not support high precision applications.
BTS metadata states –
“The Ports database is a geographic database of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Ports in and around the United States, for analytical studies of waterway performance, for compiling commodity flow statistics, and for mapping purposes.”
descript.supplinf: This dataset, as well as many others, was compiled for mapping and download as part of the Web site titled "A GIS Atlas for Indiana," funded by the Indiana Department of Transportation. Many publicly available datasets were created, edited, and compiled inclusion on the Web site where users can download data or map online using ESRI ArcIMS. Many public data sources, not created in conjunction with the statewide project, were obtained by Web site download, contacting originators, and creating spatial files from tabular data. A range of layer editing was used, specific to each layer, from full creation, to data cleaning, to only reformatting metadata. The level of editing done by BLA or the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) is fully disclosed in the process steps of this metadata; credit for the information is retained by the originator.

theme.themekey: U. S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE)

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcView version 3.2 shapefile format, approximately 160 Kb

attracc.attraccr: The attribute accuracy is tested by manual comparison of the source with hard copy print-outs and/or symbolized display of digital line graphs on an interactive computer graphic system; selected attributes that cannot be visually verified on plots or on screen, are interactively queried and verified on screen.

dataqual.logic: Unknown. No records exist at Bernardin-Lochmueller & Assoc. regarding the logical consistency of this shapefile. For more information, contact the Bureau of Transportation Statistics (www.bts.gov).
dataqual.complete: No records were available from BTS on completeness of this file, but it is assumed to be all ports in waterways bordering Indiana.

horizpa.horizpar: The accuracy of each point element is correlated to the data source used to derive that element. For example, links and nodes derived from 1:100,000 scale Digital Line Graphs are more accurate than links and nodes derived from 1:500,000 scale NOAA Navigational Charts. Elements with an "M" in the source field (indicating an unknown or missing source) are the least accurate.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

citeinfo.origin: Vanderbilt Engineering Center for Transportation Operations and Research, Vanderbilt University
citeinfo.title: USACE Port Database
U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Ports
citeinfo.othercit: Data is part of the National Transportation Atlas Database, NTAD

procstep.procdesc: Extraction of the USACE identified port nodes from the National Waterway Network file.
Ports shapefile extracted for Indiana was downloaded from the BTS NTAD website on August 5, 2002. The file was converted to UTM83 coordinates.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

attr.attrdef: The SHAPE attribute is a data attribute inherent to the ESRI shapefile format. It defines the vector data as point, polyline or polygon. For further information concerning the definition of SHAPE, consult ESRI documentation.
Code designating what organization modified the link to which this node is attached and how

edom.edomvd: Vanderbilt Addition and Digitized from NOAA charts

attr.attrdef: Unique point identification code. Links to NODEID in the USACE Waterway Network

distinfo.distliab:
No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA/IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA/IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA/IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
